verbose_text: As CD4 + T cells are the major producer of IFN-gamma during T. congolense infection and excessive production of IFN-gamma kills infected BALB/c mice, a strategy was developed with the aim to maintain an optimal production of IFN-gamma by partial depletion of CD4 + T cells using high and low doses of ant-CD4 mAb.
evidence: CD4 +  T cells are the major producer of IFN-gamma
